title: [Core Engine] Task 1.1 — Define Evidence Bundle Schema
body:
Description:
Create a formal schema for evidence bundles, specifying critic outputs, metadata, input snapshots, and internal version IDs.

Rationale:
Evidence bundles are the atomic unit of reasoning across critics. A strict schema ensures consistency and safe aggregation.

Functional Requirements:
- Create `schemas/evidence_bundle.json`
- Define critic output fields
- Define justification field
- Define metadata block (timestamps, critic name, config version)
- Define input snapshot section
- Add version tag

Acceptance Criteria:
- JSON schema validates a set of test bundles
- Validation errors are descriptive
- Downstream aggregator can parse the schema

Definition of Done:
Schema file created, validated, documented.

title: [Core Engine] Task 1.2 — Implement Evidence Normalizer
body:
Description:
Implement a normalizer that converts raw critic outputs into the unified evidence bundle schema.

Rationale:
Critic outputs vary; normalization guarantees structure and reduces downstream error cases.

Functional Requirements:
- Create `core/evidence_normalizer.py`
- Map critic raw output → schema format
- Auto-fill missing fields
- Attach metadata from config

Acceptance Criteria:
- All critic outputs normalize without errors
- Missing fields are handled gracefully
- Normalized bundle passes schema validation

title: [Core Engine] Task 1.3 — Add Metadata Enrichment
body:
Description:
Add system metadata (timestamps, latency, config props) to each evidence bundle.

Rationale:
Metadata is essential for observability, policy checks, audit trails.

Functional Requirements:
- Add timestamp generation
- Add critic execution timing
- Add config version
- Add aggregator run ID

Acceptance Criteria:
- Metadata appears in every bundle
- Timing fields are non-zero
- Bundle still validates against schema

title: [Core Engine] Task 1.4 — Implement Serialization/Deserialization
body:
Description:
Provide strict methods for converting evidence bundles to/from JSON.

Requirements:
- Implement `to_json()` and `from_json()`
- Ensure strict validation on load
- Provide error messages on structural mismatch

title: [Core Engine] Task 1.5 — Write EvidenceBundle Unit Tests
body:
Description:
Write test suite validating normalization, serialization, and schema compliance.

Requirements:
- Positive tests for valid bundles
- Negative tests for invalid/missing fields
- Ensure test coverage for normalization edge-cases

title: [Core Engine] Task 2.1 — Add Critic Weighting
body:
Description:
Add numeric weighting to critic outputs to influence aggregation.

Requirements:
- Add weighting field to critic config
- Aggregator must incorporate weighting
- Create tests verifying new weighting logic

title: [Core Engine] Task 2.2 — Implement Conflict Detection
body:
Description:
Detect contradictory critic outputs and return structured conflict objects.

Examples:
- Two critics yield opposing classifications
- Confidence levels diverge sharply

Acceptance Criteria:
- Conflict objects exposed to policy engine
- Logged in observability

title: [Core Engine] Task 2.3 — Multi-Critic Justification Synthesis
body:
Description:
Aggregate all critic justifications into a unified explanation.

Requirements:
- Surface critic-level reasoning
- Merge into a composite justification
- Highlight agreement vs disagreement

title: [Core Engine] Task 2.4 — Aggregator Test Suite
body:
Description:
Comprehensive tests for aggregator behavior.

Coverage:
- Weighted aggregation
- Conflict detection
- Fallback scenarios
- Missing critic output

title: [Core Engine] Task 3.1 — Implement Precedent Storage Backend
body:
Description:
Add a precedent store using SQLite/Postgres.

Requirements:
- `precedents` table
- Store: query, evidence bundle, decision
- Indexing for efficient lookup

title: [Core Engine] Task 3.2 — Create Precedent Ingestion Pipeline
body:
Description:
Automatically store each completed decision into precedent storage.

Functional Requirements:
- Trigger after aggregator and policy stages
- Include evidence bundle snapshot
- Include final verdict and justification

title: [Core Engine] Task 3.3 — Implement Similarity Search Wrapper
body:
Description:
Similarity search for precedent retrieval using embeddings.

Requirements:
- Cosine similarity
- Embedding model wrapper
- Retrieve top-k relevant precedents

title: [Core Engine] Task 3.4 — Implement Precedent Ranking Function
body:
Description:
Rank precedents based on similarity + recency + relevance.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Ranking stable across runs
- Recency weighting tunable

title: [Core Engine] Task 3.5 — Precedent Engine Tests
body:
Description:
Unit tests validating:
- Storage
- Retrieval
- Ranking
- Error conditions

title: [Core Engine] Task 4.1 — Formalize Policy Rule Interface
body:

Define a strongly-typed rule structure and policy evaluation interface.

Requirements:
- Create `/core/policy/rules.py`
- Standard rule fields
- Compliance flags

title: [Core Engine] Task 4.2 — Add Threshold Rules
body:
Description:
Implement threshold-based rules (e.g., minimum confidence, critic agreement, conflict tolerance).

Functional Requirements:
- Configurable thresholds
- Enforcement inside policy engine
- Structured failure messages

Acceptance Criteria:
- Decision flagged when threshold fails
- Logged for audit + observability

title: [Core Engine] Task 4.3 — Implement Compliance Flags

Add compliance outcome indicators: `passes`, `borderline`, `fails`.

Requirements:

- Included in final decision object
- Propagated to audit log

body:

Requirements:

body:

Coverage:

body:

Requirements:

- Highlight consistencies/inconsistencies
- Support long-form and short-form modes

body:
Description:
Add stub for counterfactual generation: “Decision would change if X differed.”

Requirements:
- Basic template generation
- No model-based reasoning yet
- Integration point documented

title: [Core Engine] Task 5.4 — Explainability Tests
body:
Description:
Test suite validating:
- Individual critic explanations
- Aggregated explanation correctness
- Counterfactual formatting

title: [Core Engine] Task 6.1 — Fallback Evidence Bundle
body:
Description:
Schema for capturing fallback events, including reasons and fallback decision.

Requirements:

- `failed_critics`
- `system_state_at_trigger`

title: [Core Engine] Task 6.2 — Implement Fallback Logic

- Timeouts occur

Acceptance Criteria:
- Fallback decision always safe
- Logged and auditable

- Clear failure reasons
- List affected critics
- Safety rationale

body:

Test fallback handling under:
- Timeouts
- Missing critic output
- Conflicts

body:

body:

Test:
